archiefmat.titel_eng: Archive of the De Lannoy family
archiefmat.scope: Contains documents regarding, real estate and other property, left estates, testaments, financial affairs, public activities and functions etc of the Lannoy family and the related families Nio, Insernia, De Windt, Senior, Pierre, and others. Samuel de Lannoy arrived in Curaçao in 1737. He married Anna Elisabeth Martin. From this marriage a son was born named Jan Hendrik (1737-1798). Jan Hendrik de Lannoy became a planter. He had two sons with the free black woman Dominga Sabana, alias Dominga Gracia: Andries Louis de Lannoy (1761-1829) and Albertus Gregorius de Lannoy. The latter presumably died at a young age. Andries Louis became a planter like his father and had three children.
